main_definition: An uncertainty, possibility, condition, doubt etc.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An uncertainty, possibility, condition, doubt etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: If it rains tomorrow, the picnic will have to be postponed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Supposing that, assuming that, in the circumstances that; used to introduce a condition or choice.
meanings_and_examples.example: If it rains, I shall get wet.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In the event that a statement is true (a programming statement that acts in a similar manner).
meanings_and_examples.example: If A, then B, else C.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Supposing that; used with past or past perfect subjunctive indicating that the condition is closed.
meanings_and_examples.example: I would be unhappy if you had not talked with me yesterday.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Supposing that; given that; supposing it is the case that.
meanings_and_examples.example: If that's true, we had better get moving!

meanings_and_examples.definition: Although; used to introduce a concession.
meanings_and_examples.example: He was a great friend, if a little stingy at the bar.

meanings_and_examples.definition: (sometimes proscribed) Whether; used to introduce a noun clause, an indirect question, that functions as the direct object of certain verbs.
meanings_and_examples.example: I don't know if I want to go or not.

meanings_and_examples.definition: (usually hyperbolic) Even if; even in the circumstances that.
meanings_and_examples.example: If I were a millionaire, I would buy an island and throw extravagant parties for everyone.
I have leftover cake if you want some.
